ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great course, you can learn a great deal.
Great overview/introductory course. The final project was a very relevant and useful assignment.
Good. I thought the course presented a good overview of various environmental hormonal exposures.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Dr. Zhang is very easy going and insightful, helpful.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Dr. Zhang is an excellent professor, cares about her students.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Dr. Zhang is a good lecturer and very sensitive as to when students are struggling with the material.

Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Her lectures were well summarized and easy to follow. She was willing to help and answer with any questions student have. She gives thoughtful and constructive feedback to the midterm and presentation, which helped me to learn what I did wrong and how to improve.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course for it is very good.
We are constantly effected by our environments and this course will show you exactly how that plays a role on our hormones. A good class to take.
Great overview/introductory course. Would recommend to anyone interested in environmental health sciences.
If you are interested in the topic, yes.
